title: Shared library option
body:
I am currently working on an integration of CaDiCaL and its IPASIR-UP interface for Julia. To this end, I need CaDiCaL as a shared library. I have seen in #40 and #100 that there is, in principle, interest in adding this feature.

Based on the comments from these two pages, I have reconstructed the `--shared` functionality from Kissat for CaDiCaL in this pull request. Is this the change you had in mind for this feature?

To summarize:
- By default only the static library is built
- The `-shared` option activates `-fpic` and builds the shared library in addition to the static library

Since this code was essentially taken from Kissat's build files, I have not yet signed the commit.
If you agree with this, I'm happy to sign it to have the pull request merged...

title: Add getting equivalent literals
body:
This quick hack allows one to get equivalent literals from the outside. It gathers all equivalences during decompose(), so there is some memory overhead. However, it should be small. The memory is packed (with std::pair and std::vector), so it's not too bad.

Quite useful -- sometimes after a CaDiCaL call, it can be useful to extract units, and equivalences. I use this in my version of CadiBack, for model counting. It actually helps. File `mc2024_track2-random_186.cnf.gz` when preprocessed with equivalences obtained from CadiBack:

```
c o --- [ backbone statistics ] ------------------------------------------------
c o
c o found              9009 backbones      16%
c o dropped           45860 candidates     84%
c o
c o filtered          45158 candidates     82%
c o flippable             7 candidates      0%
c o flipped               0 candidates      0%
c o fixed              8789 candidates     16%
c o core                  0 candidates      0%
c o found                 0 big_backbone   0%
c o failed                0 candidates      0%
c o
c o called solver       869 times           2%
c o satisfiable         696 times          80%
c o unsatisfiable       173 times          20%
c o
c o --- [ backbone profiling ] -------------------------------------------------
c o
c o         1.90   1.24 % first
c o         5.73   3.75 % sat
c o         2.73   1.78 % unsat
c o         1.90   1.24 % satmax
c o         1.49   0.98 % unsatmax
c o         8.46   5.53 % solving
c o         0.68   0.45 % flip
c o ====================================
c o         9.48 100.00 % total
c o
c o
c o
c o exit 10
c o [backbone-simpl] res: 10 num units added: 6500 num eq added: 180 num bins: 389 T: 14.08
```

Notice the 180 equivalent literals received.

The difference in the preprocessed CNF:
```
 804   │ c o ind size: 208 nvars: 815
...
 807   │ c o Sampling set size: 208
 808   │ c o Opt sampling set size: 815
 809   │ c o Bin irred/red      988        3698
 810   │ c o Long irred cls/tri 1391       1067
 811   │ c o Long red cls/tri   9154       3578
```

vs:

```
 801   │ c o ind size: 208 nvars: 842
...
 804   │ c o Sampling set size: 208
 805   │ c o Opt sampling set size: 842
 806   │ c o Bin irred/red      1050       4015
 807   │ c o Long irred cls/tri 1407       1077
 808   │ c o Long red cls/tri   10108      3552
```

title: fix: remove incorrect forward-declarations
body:
This code was trying to forward-declare `CaDiCaL::FileTracer`, but was actually forward-declaring `::FileTracer`. Forward-declarations are nonsensical here anyway, as it is not legal to use forward-declarations as a base class.

Instead, this includes the header that defines the class, which is consistent with what `src/drattracer.hpp` already does.

title: Fixes for __WIN32 build:
body:
* __WIN32 is replaced with _WIN32 (both were used inconsistently)
* CADICAL_ATTRIBUTE_FORMAT is disabled
* __builtin_clz is replaced with _BitScanReverse
* getpid is replaced with GetCurrentProcessId
* __PRETTY_FUNCTION__ is replaced with __FUNCTION__
* __builtin_prefetch is replaced with _m_prefetch
* unistd.h is always guarded with #ifdef
* io operations (isatty, etc) are defined with macros

title: mobical.cpp: define MAP_ANONYMOUS if undefined
body: Trivial fix for platforms where `MAP_ANONYMOUS` is not present.

title: Adding missing #include to incproof.cpp
body: The `getenv` function is provided by `<cstdlib>`, and the fact that on some compilers it can be found through `<cstdio>` (via `cadical.hpp`) is not guaranteed by the standard.

title: Added memory fuzzing to mobical
body:
The following changes have been done:
- Added option to enable memory fuzzing via configure script (`./configure --memory-fuzzing`)
- Added two options to mobical to check for crashes (`--bad-alloc`) caused by bad allocations and memory leaks (`--leak-alloc`)
- Added two new trace entries (`max_alloc` and `leak_alloc`) that specify the limit for the allocator beyond which it will produce a failed allocation and enables the memory leak tracking
- Added comments to mobical trace files which contain stack traces when a crash or memory leak has been detected
- Added mobical option to generate tiny samples (`--tiny`) to make fuzzing faster

`--memory-fuzzing` has a huge runtime impact due to malloc hooks, and should only be enabled when actually performing memory fuzzing:
- Mobical compiled without `--memory-fuzzing`: 2.163 s
- Mobical compiled with `--memory-fuzzing`: 14.036 s
- Mobical compiled with `--memory-fuzzing` and running with `--bad-alloc`: 14.071 s
- Mobical compiled with `--memory-fuzzing` and running with `--leak-alloc`: 16.980 s

# New memory trace outputs

Example mobical trace output of `mobical --bad-alloc` for a crash after a bad allocation:

```
0 max_alloc 10320
1 init
2 set check 1
3 configure default
# V---------------------------------------------------------------------- bad alloc: allocation
4 add -9
5 add 0
# V---------------------------------------------------------------------- bad alloc: crashed
6 reset
# ---------------------------------------------------
# Memory was tried to be allocated here:
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Trace::hook_malloc(unsigned long)+0x1ad) [0x560a158d481d]
# libstdc++.so.6(operator new(unsigned long)+0x1c) [0x7f07af636f0c]
# mobical(std::vector<signed char, std::allocator<signed char> >::_M_fill_insert(__gnu_cxx::__normal_iterator<signed char*, std::vector<signed char, std::allocator<signed char> > >, unsigned long, signed char const&)+0x109) [0x560a15948d49]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Internal::enlarge(int)+0x406) [0x560a159479e6]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Internal::init_vars(int)+0x75) [0x560a15947c45]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::External::init(int)+0x6a) [0x560a1593e0aa]
# mobical(+0xa67a0) [0x560a1593e7a0]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::External::add(int)+0xba) [0x560a1593e91a]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Solver::add(int)+0xc0) [0x560a159225b0]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Trace::execute()+0x11e) [0x560a158ede6e]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Trace::fork_and_execute()+0x92) [0x560a158d8392]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Trace::shrink(int)+0x30a) [0x560a158e366a]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Mobical::main(int, char**)+0xf13) [0x560a158d3113]
# libc.so.6(+0x2638a) [0x7f07af2b038a]
# libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0x8c) [0x7f07af2b044c]
# mobical(_start+0x25) [0x560a158d4545]
#
# ---------------------------------------------------
# A crash happened here:
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Trace::child_signal_handler(int)+0x166) [0x560a158d71d6]
# libc.so.6(+0x3d050) [0x7f07af2c7050]
# libc.so.6(+0x9126c) [0x7f07af31b26c]
# libc.so.6(gsignal+0x1e) [0x7f07af2c6f9e]
# libc.so.6(abort+0xdf) [0x7f07af2ae8ff]
# libc.so.6(+0x2599d) [0x7f07af2af99d]
# libc.so.6(+0x9b6a5) [0x7f07af3256a5]
# libc.so.6(+0x9da2c) [0x7f07af327a2c]
# libc.so.6(__libc_free+0x7e) [0x7f07af32a4de]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Trace::hook_free(void*)+0x16) [0x560a158d4b36]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Internal::~Internal()+0x4af) [0x560a159431af]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Solver::~Solver()+0x9d) [0x560a159210fd]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::ResetCall::execute(CaDiCaL::Solver*&)+0x1e) [0x560a158e81de]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Trace::execute()+0x11e) [0x560a158ede6e]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Trace::fork_and_execute()+0x92) [0x560a158d8392]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Trace::shrink(int)+0x30a) [0x560a158e366a]
# mobical(CaDiCaL::Mobical::main(int, char**)+0xf13) [0x560a158d3113]
# libc.so.6(+0x2638a) [0x7f07af2b038a]
# libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0x8c) [0x7f07af2b044c]
# mobical(_start+0x25) [0x560a158d4545]
#
```

Example mobical trace output of `mobical --bad-alloc --leak-alloc` for a memory leak after a bad allocation:


title: Added replacement for closefrom for Mac
Fixed fork() cloning unwanted file descriptors
Fix issues with memory safety when allocation fails
body:
Fixes various conditions where consistency and memory safety can't be guaranteed in case of a failed allocation.
The goal is to guarantee the CaDiCaL instance can be deallocated and no memory is leaked after std::bad_alloc has been thrown by the allocator.

The fixes correct the following problems:

- Assumptions that are invalidated (vectors that are incrementally built)
- Arena affiliation check for clauses that ignores the new arena
- Garbage collection that can't handle an inconsistent state
- Reallocations happening between updating essential pointers
- Profiling still being active after failed allocation
- Memory being leaked using manual memory management (new, delete)

ToDo:
- [x] Compilation / regression test (Tobias)
- [x] Performance regression test on cluster
- [x] Manual code review (Armin / Mathias)
- ~~[ ] Evaluation for non-x86 platforms without TSO~~ (Terminator shouldn't cause bad allocations)
- [ ] Upstreaming of memory fuzzing in Mobical (separate Pull Request)

body: This verifies that tests pass on master and in PRs.

body:
This fixes this build failure:
```
src/random.cpp:112:48: error: invalid application of 'sizeof' to an incomplete type 'struct sockaddr_in'
  112 |         const int size = (family == AF_INET) ? sizeof (struct sockaddr_in)
      |                                                ^      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

FreeBSD 14.1

title: Add CMake configuration
body:
I saw that you thought about adding CMake support but wanted to support all features from the current configuration script.

This could be used as a starting point for that. Some options like release/debug build or compiler flags are possible with CMake without any further customization.

In case you do not want to merge this in the current state, what should be added at a minimum?

title: Add missing `#include` to radix.hpp
body: `std::vector` is used in this header, but `<vector>` is never imported.

title: modify the `LC_TIME` from `en_US` to `C`
body:
Modify the `LC_TIME` from `en_US` (which might not exists, since it is `en_US.UTF8` that exists.) to `C`.

According to [GNU's documents](https://www.gnu.org/software/gettext/manual/html_node/The-LANGUAGE-variable.html#The-LANGUAGE-variable), `LC_TIME=C` should always work, which seems better than `en_US`.

title: Update internal.cpp
body:
Fix missing parentesis in if statement.
(I think this wasn't being triggered because this function was only being called when vsize=0)

title: Also add a dynamic library
body:
This also builds a dynamic library, besides a static one. I have  a feeling it may have been purposefully left out, but I need it, and I think it may not be too harmful to do it? Just a suggestion.

Mate

title: Added documentation of incremental Craig tracer use
Fixed issue where Craig tracer handled restored clauses incorrectly
body: - Fixed code where previously restored clauses where assumed to be originally added clauses

title: Added option to disable IPASIR interface
body:
Allows preventing accidentally linking against the CaDiCaL IPASIR interface when using together with other solvers.

Example:
```bash
(cd mysolver && ./configure.sh && make -j)
(cd cadical && ./configure.sh && make -j)
(cd bmc-prover && ./configure.sh --cadical=../cadical --ipasir=../mysolver/libipasirmysolver.a && make -j)
```

If mysolver defines only a few of the IPASIR functions, the linker could pick some implementations from CaDiCaL's IPASIR API.
This potentially results in crashes during runtime.

title: Added Craig interpolant creating tracer

- Added support for contributed code

- Added documentation for CraigTracer
- Added tests for CraigTracer

Fixed copy & paste error in test/icnf/makefile
Added Dockerfile to build and run CaDiCaL
body: Minimalistic Dockerfile to build and run CaDiCaL

title: Add cmake FetchContent support
body: Adds cmake FetchContent support so other cmake users can easily add this project as a dependency. We plan to use this for our open-source quantum circuit synthesis tool [qysn](https://github.com/DVLab-NTU/qsyn). It would be nice if you could accept this PR. This CMakeLists.txt only has the library build, I can help you add a binary build option if you're interested.

title: chore: add cmake build system
body: add a cmake configuration to support cmake FetchContent

title: Fixing Option Ordering
body:
Resolving the following error after compilation:
cadical: fatal error: 'instantiateonce' ordered before 'idrup' in 'options.hpp'

title: WIP: C interface for IPASIR-UP
body:
This PR adds a C interface for the functionality added by the IPASIR-UP API. The `CCaDiCaLPropagator` has a single attached `state` that is given to all call back functions added to the external propagator.

I've tried to keep all code in IPASIR and CCaDiCaL as much in style as possible.

I've marked this PR as `WIP` because the comments added are currently only copied from the triggered code. I will adjust them to be specific to the interface, and add the missing documentation to the undocumented functions.

I would love to get any feedback on the interface design, code style, or any other details

title: Fix LRAT error handling in Solver::set().
body:
This fixes incorrect error handling to guard not using lrat with
external propagators, which caused the guard to fire every time
Solver::set() was called.

title: Create 'src/makefile' symlink during configure
body: Closes #36.

title: Compatibility with C++11
body:
* also remove the deprecated ualarm
* C++11 instead of C++14
* Should also fix part of #32.

title: Change code to be compatible with C++11
body: Should also fix part of #32.

title: Remove `;` at closing bracket of namespace and extern C declaration
body: This removes the warnings about `warning: extra ‘;’ [-Wpedantic]` when compiling with `g++` with `-Wall -Wpedantic`, see also #4

title: Allow user specific CXXFLAGS.
body:
Only append to CXXFLAGS in configure script in order to allow user specific CXXFLAGS,
e.g., CXXFLAGS="-fPIC" ./configure

title: Add CMake files for building and testing.
body:
This allows building with e.g. Visual Studio.

All unit tests and regression tests will be run with

    ctest .

after building.

Not all parameters will be present in config.hpp yet.
